III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12504 Eligibility requirements
Section
Description
1

(3) An independent living home, staffed and operated by the child
placing agency, must be clean, safe, and appropriate to the needs
of the youth it serves.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There is mold and furnace issues causing youth to be sick. Youth
do not have access to food.
Investigation Interviews:
I completed onsite visits on 11/01/2023 and 11/07/2023 with State
Worker 1. We interviewed Staff 1 on 11/01/2023. Staff 1 stated
the furnace for the home was recently repaired and the air
conditioner for the home had developed a leak that caused
moisture in the ceiling and some of the ceiling plaster to collapse.
Staff 1 stated the air conditioner had also been repaired as well as
the ceiling area. Staff 1 stated the home is constantly in need of
repairs as youth cause damage to doors and walls when the youth
are upset. Staff 1 stated the home has a food pantry that youth
can use when the youth does not have food from the youth's
stipend payments. Staff 1 stated the youth have assigned daily
chores and when they are not done the staff will often times do the
chores. Staff 1 stated the Probation Officer of one the youth
authorized the facility to withhold the youth's stipend payment
when the youth is not cooperating with the program until the youth
comes into compliance.
State Worker 1 interviewed Youth D separately at the hospital on
11/01/2023. Excerpts from that interview are as follows: State
Worker 1 made an unscheduled visit to St. John's Hospital to visit
Youth D. The well-being of Youth D was verified. There were no
visible injuries or bruises observed on the youth. Youth D reported
he does not feel safe at the facility, and they have been holding
his check, so he does not get enough food to eat. Youth D
reported he has his own room and bed. Youth D reported for
discipline they hold his check, or they get a write up.
The allegations were addressed with Youth D. Youth D reported
that the furnace is making them sick because it was fixed but a
new filter was not installed. Youth D reported the house is not
ready for residents to reside there.
On 11/07/2023 State Worker 1 and I completed another onsite
visit of the home. We interviewed Youth A, Youth B, Staff 2, Staff
3, and Staff 4.
2

Youth A stated he felt safe at the facility. Youth A stated he had
been placed there since June 20223. Youth A stated he has
enough food. Youth A stated for discipline a youth is written up or
they may have some of their stipend money withheld for a few
days. Youth A stated staff help with chores and denied staff will
trash a room. Youth A stated he did not know anything about any
mold. Youth A stated sometimes staff will take them shopping.
Youth B stated he felt safe at the facility. Youth B reported he has
been placed there since June 2023. Youth B stated that for
discipline staff will talk with the youth. Youth B stated staff
sometimes help to clean and denied staff will trash a room.
Youth B stated he didn't know anything about mold.
Staff 2 stated for discipline the staff will talk with youth and redirect
youth or complete an incident report. Staff 2 did not know
anything about any mold or the withholding of any stipend
payments. Staff 2 stated there is a food pantry that youth can use
with staff assistance.
Staff 3 stated she has worked at the home for approximately 9 or
10 years. Staff 3 stated for discipline a youth may be written up.
Staff 3 stated she did not know anything about any mold. Staff 3
stated that a youth may sometimes only receive a partial payment
from the stipend money until the youth meets the program
expectations. Staff 3 stated the partial payment is only delayed
and not lost. Staff 3 stated youth can use the food pantry as
needed, with staff assistance.
Staff 4's comments were consistent with the comments made by
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3.
A conference was held on 11/29/2023 regarding the findings of
the investigation completed by State Worker 1. State Worker 1
did not have any findings regarding the allegations.
Tour
The furnace was operational and there were no adverse
problems/concerns noted at the time of the visit. The repairs to
the ceiling had been made and no mold was observed. The pantry
was also observed along with a main floor freezer.
Documents Reviewed
R 400.12503 Policy and Procedures for the agency was reviewed.
The policy indicated the youth can receive partial stipend
3

payments as a form of program participation and then receive the
balance of the payments when completing program expectations.
Analysis The findings of this investigation do not support the allegations as
presented. Interviews with program participants and staff do not
support the allegations that the furnace is making participants sick
or that there is mold in the home to make people sick. The
agency is following their policy regarding stipend distributions.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
Description and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff trash the home and youth are made to clean it. Youth called
an ambulance for themself due to throwing up blood and having
breathing issues in the night. Around 7/4/23, one youth cracked
another youth's nose. Four weeks ago, this same youth came
back to the home and pulled a gun on a youth. Staff did not
respond appropriately. Staff are intoxicated and yell often. There
are people trying to get into the home or waiting for youth to leave
the home with ill intent.
Investigation Interviews:
I completed onsite visits on 11/01/2023 and 11/07/2023 with State
Worker 1. We interviewed Staff 1 on 11/01/2023. Staff 1 stated
that when a former program participant threatened another youth
outside in the street, the police were called to deal with the
situation.
State Worker 1 and I also interviewed Youth C on 11/01/2023.
Youth C alleged the staff will tear up a youth's room when looking
for contraband, and then the youth has to straighten the room
again. Youth C did not provide an example beyond making the
accusation. Youth C alleged Staff 1 drinks and yells at the youth.
However, Youth C did not state he had ever observed Staff 1
drinking. Youth C stated there was an incident when a former
program participant threatened another youth outside in the street
near the home. Youth C reported the police were called. Youth C
stated some staff were OK and some staff would yell at the youth
referring to Staff 1.
4

The allegations were addressed with Youth D. Youth D informed
State Worker 1 that Youth D has smelled alcohol on the breath of
Staff 1. Youth D reported Staff 1 called Youth D a "bitch" for telling
on the former resident who attempted to rob Youth D. Youth D
reported he told one of the workers that he was going to cash his
check and a former resident tried to rob him. Youth D reported he
has been sick and throwing up blood for the last couple of weeks.
Youth D reported he has asked the staff to take him to the
hospital, but they just put him off. Youth D reported he called
emergency services, and they sent an ambulance to the house to
pick him up. He stated he has been at the hospital since
10/31/2023. Youth D reported Staff 1 was upset with him because
he did not go to school.
On 11/07/2023 State Worker 1 and I completed another onsite
visit of the home. We interviewed Youth A, Youth B, Staff 2, Staff
3, and Staff 4.
Youth A stated he felt safe at the facility. Youth A stated he had
been placed there since June 20223. Youth A stated staff help
with chores and denied staff will trash a room. Youth A stated he
did not know anything about staff drinking. Youth A described staff
as being helpful anytime a youth is sick. Youth A stated
sometimes staff will take them shopping.
Youth B stated he felt safe at the facility. Youth B reported he has
been placed there since June 2023. Youth B stated staff
sometimes help to clean and denied staff will trash a room. Youth
B stated that when the former participant made the threats
outside, the staff called the police. Youth B stated staff is helpful
when someone is sick. Youth B denied staff drinking or fighting
with youth.
Staff 2 stated for discipline the staff will talk with youth and redirect
youth or complete an incident report. Staff 2 denied any staff
drinking or trashing a youth's room. Staff 2 also stated that the
police were called during the incident that occurred outside in the
street. Staff 2 did not report Youth D had asked to go to the
hospital.
Staff 3 stated she has worked at the home for approximately 9 or
10 years. Staff 3 stated for discipline a youth may be written up.
Staff 3 denied staff drinking or trashing a youth's room. Staff 3
stated staff will assist youth when they are sick. Staff 3 did not
report Youth D had asked to go to the hospital.
5

Staff 3 stated she wasn't present at the time of the incident outside
involving a former youth, but it was reported the staff called the
police at the time of the incident.
Staff 4's comments were consistent with the comments made by
Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 3.
A conference was held on 11/29/2023 regarding the findings of
the investigation completed by State Worker 1. State Worker 1 did
not have any findings regarding the allegations.
Document Review
The case record indicated Youth D had previously complained
about going to the hospital, but the findings/diagnosis at that time
was that Youth D did not require any medical treatment. At the
time of the onsite visit on 11/01/2023 Youth D was hospitalized
overnight for an abscess on Youth D’s tonsil. At the time of the
second onsite visit on 11/07/2023 Youth D had been returned to
the facility.
Staff 4 who is also a program administrator did not report any
disciplinary issues/concerns for Staff 1.
Analysis The interviews did not support the allegations that staff yell at the
youth or are inappropriate with the youth, are intoxicated while
working, or do not respond to the youth’s needs.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
